TITLE: Markdown Front Matter Configuration DESCRIPTION: YAML front matter block defining the title and order of the documentation page within the Hanami guides. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/actions/_index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` --- title: Actions order: 50 --- ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Refactored Hanami Action Handling 404 via ROM Exception - Ruby DESCRIPTION: Improves Hanami action by using rom-rb's .one! method and handling missing records with custom exception logic via config.handle_exception. 'handle_not_found' renders 404 JSON error. Inputs: Valid integer ID. Outputs: JSON book data or JSON error with status 404. Dependencies: Hanami, rom-rb. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.0/introduction/getting-started.md#2025-04-23_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # app/actions/books/show.rb require "rom" module Bookshelf module Actions module Books class Show < Bookshelf::Action include Deps["persistence.rom"] config.handle_exception ROM::TupleCountMismatchError => :handle_not_found params do required(:id).value(:integer) end def handle(request, response) book = rom.relations[:books].by_pk( request.params[:id] ).one! response.format = :json response.body = book.to_json end private def handle_not_found(_request, response, _exception) response.status = 404 response.format = :json response.body = {error: "not_found"}.to_json end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Custom Status Code for Redirects in Hanami DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set a custom HTTP status code for a redirect route. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/routing/overview.md#2025-04-23_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` redirect "/old", to: "/temporary-new", code: 302 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Hanami Action Options DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure various options for a Hanami action, such as setting the HTTP method, specifying accepted formats, and defining a custom name for the action. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/actions/_index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Books class Index < Action config.method = :get config.formats = [:html, :json] config.name = :books def handle(request, response) # Action logic... end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Books Index Template in ERB DESCRIPTION: Template for rendering the books index page with a list of books. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/introduction/building-a-web-app.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: sql CODE: ```

Books

    <% books.each do |book| %>
  • <%= book[:title] %>
    • <% end %>
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining a Hanami App in Ruby DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to define a basic Hanami App class. It inherits from Hanami::App and includes a configuration block where various settings can be specified. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/app/_index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # config/app.rb require "hanami" module MyApp class App < Hanami::App config do # Add your app-wide configuration settings here end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining a Base Action Class with Authentication in Hanami DESCRIPTION: Creates a base action class that includes dependencies, sets JSON formatting, and implements authentication via a before callback. All actions inheriting from this class will receive these behaviors. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/actions/inheritance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # apps/action.rb module Bookshelf class Action < Hanami::Action include Deps["authenticator"] format :json before :authenticate_user! private def authenticate_user!(request, response) halt 401 unless authenticator.valid_api_token?(request.headers["X-API-Token"]) end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Associations in a Relation Schema DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to define associations within a relation schema. It shows how to set up 'has_many' relationships, including a through association. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/database/overview.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` class Users < Hanami::DB::Relation schema(infer: true) do associations do has_many :users_tasks has_many :tasks, through: :users_tasks end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Separate Class for Parameter Validation in Hanami DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use a separate class for parameter validation in a Hanami action, improving reusability and testability. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/actions/parameters.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # app/actions/users/params/create.rb module Bookshelf module Actions module Users module Params class Create < Hanami::Action::Params params do required(:email).filled(:string) required(:password).filled(:string) required(:address).hash do required(:street).filled(:string) required(:country).filled(:string) end end end end end end end ``` LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # app/actions/users/create.rb module Bookshelf module Actions module Users class Create < Bookshelf::Action params Params::Create def handle(request, response) # ... end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Advanced Parameter Validation and Coercion in Hanami Action DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates advanced parameter validation and coercion techniques in a Hanami action, including type checking, format validation, and size constraints. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v1.3/actions/parameters.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # apps/web/controllers/signup/create.rb module Web module Controllers module Signup class Create include Web::Action MEGABYTE = 1024 ** 2 params do required(:name).filled(:str?) required(:email).filled(:str?, format?: /@/).confirmation required(:password).filled(:str?).confirmation required(:terms_of_service).filled(:bool?) required(:age).filled(:int?, included_in?: 18..99) optional(:avatar).filled(size?: 1..(MEGABYTE * 3)) end def call(params) if params.valid? # ... else # ... end end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Pagination in ROM Relation for Books - Ruby DESCRIPTION: Defines a ROM relation class for 'books' with support for schema inference and pagination using the pagination plugin. Sets a default of 5 books per page. This is used to enable paginated queries via ROM, serving as a backend for paginated API endpoints. Requires the ROM gem and its SQL adapter. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/introduction/building-an-api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf module Persistence module Relations class Books < ROM::Relation[:sql] schema(:books, infer: true) use :pagination per_page 5 end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Custom Method Handlers for Exception Handling in Hanami DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use both status codes and custom methods for exception handling in a Hanami action. RecordNotFound exceptions return a 404 status, while StandardError is handled by a custom method that returns a JSON response with a custom error message. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/actions/exception-handling.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf module Actions module Books class Index < Bookshelf::Action handle_exception RecordNotFound => 404 handle_exception StandardError => :handle_standard_error def handle(*, response) raise "error" end private def handle_standard_error(request, response, exception) response.status = 500 response.format = :json response.body = {error: "Sorry, something went wrong handling your request"}.to_json end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Books Index Action with Repo Dependency in Ruby DESCRIPTION: This Ruby code modifies the `Bookshelf::Actions::Books::Index` action. It includes the `Deps["repos.book_repo"]` mixin to inject the book repository dependency, making it available via the `book_repo` method. The `handle` method now calls `book_repo.all_by_title` to fetch books, sets the response format to JSON, and serializes the book data into the response body. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/introduction/building-an-api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf module Actions module Books class Index < Bookshelf::Action include Deps["repos.book_repo"] def handle(request, response) books = book_repo.all_by_title response.format = :json response.body = books.map(&:to_h).to_json end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Base Action Class with Authentication in Hanami DESCRIPTION: Defines a base action class with authentication dependency, JSON formatting, and API token validation. This class serves as a foundation for other actions requiring these common behaviors. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/actions/inheritance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf class Action < Hanami::Action include Deps["authenticator"] format :json before :authenticate_user! private def authenticate_user!(request, response) halt 401 unless authenticator.valid_api_token?(request.headers["X-API-Token"]) end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating Hanami Relation via CLI (Shell) DESCRIPTION: This shell command uses the Hanami CLI generator to create a database relation class named `books`. Relations provide an interface for interacting with database tables. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/introduction/building-a-web-app.md#2025-04-23_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` $ bundle exec hanami generate relation books ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Settings Class in Ruby for Hanami Application DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create a Settings class in config/settings.rb to define custom application settings with types and defaults. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.0/app/settings.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # config/settings.rb module Bookshelf class Settings < Hanami::Settings # Define your app settings here, for example: # # setting :my_flag, default: false, constructor: Types::Params::Bool end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using a Specific Database Gateway in Hanami Operation DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to specify a particular database gateway when using a transaction in a Hanami operation. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/operations/overview.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` transaction(gateway: :other) do # ... end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Books Index Action in Hanami with ROM DESCRIPTION: This Hanami action class implements the books index endpoint. It uses ROM to query the books relation, orders the results, and returns them as JSON. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.0/introduction/getting-started.md#2025-04-23_snippet_24 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf module Actions module Books class Index < Bookshelf::Action include Deps["persistence.rom"] def handle(*, response) books = rom.relations[:books] .select(:title, :author) .order(:title) .to_a response.format = :json response.body = books.to_json end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Hanami Action in Ruby DESCRIPTION: Ruby code for a Hanami action class, defining the handling of a request and setting the response body. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.0/introduction/getting-started.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf module Actions module Home class Show < Bookshelf::Action def handle(*, response) response.body = "Welcome to Bookshelf" end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Various Route Types in Hanami (Ruby) DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates different ways to add routes in Hanami, including routes to actions, Rack applications, and lambda functions. It shows how to handle different HTTP methods and endpoint types. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/routing/overview.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` get "/books", to: "books.index" # Invokes the Bookshelf::Actions:Books::Index action post "/books", to: "books.create" # Invokes the Bookshelf::Actions:Books::Create action get "/rack-app", to: RackApp.new get "/my-lambda", to: ->(env) { [200, {}, ["A Rack compatible response"]] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding RSpec Request Spec for Books Index Pagination in Ruby DESCRIPTION: This RSpec test, located in `spec/requests/books/index/pagination_spec.rb`, specifically verifies the pagination functionality of the `GET /books` endpoint. It inserts 10 books in a `before` block. The test case checks that requesting page 1 with 3 items per page (`/books?page=1&per_page=3`) returns a successful response with the correct first three books. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/introduction/building-an-api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # spec/requests/books/index/pagination_spec.rb RSpec.describe "GET /books pagination", type: [:request, :db] do let(:books) { Hanami.app["relations.books"] } before do 10.times do |n| books.insert(title: "Book #{n}", author: "Author #{n}") end end context "given valid page and per_page params" do it "returns the correct page of books" do get "/books?page=1&per_page=3" expect(last_response).to be_successful response_body = JSON.parse(last_response.body) expect(response_body).to eq [ {"title" => "Book 0", "author" => "Author 0"}, {"title" => "Book 1", "author" => "Author 1"}, {"title" => "Book 2", "author" => "Author 2"} ] end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining an Autoloaded Entity Class in Ruby DESCRIPTION: Example of defining a Book entity class following Hanami's autoloading conventions with proper namespace structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/app/autoloading.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # app/entities/book.rb module Bookshelf module Entities class Book attr_reader :title, :author def initialize(title:, author:) @title = title @author = author end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initial Routes Configuration in Ruby DESCRIPTION: Basic Hanami routes configuration file setup. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/introduction/building-a-web-app.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf class Routes < Hanami::Routes # Add your routes here. See https://guides.hanamirb.org/routing/overview/ for details. end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Create Action for Books in Hanami DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Create action within the Bookshelf::Actions::Books module. It includes parameter validation, book creation using the repo, and appropriate response handling based on the validity of the request. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/introduction/building-an-api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_39 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf module Actions module Books class Create < Bookshelf::Action include Deps["repos.book_repo"] params do required(:book).hash do required(:title).filled(:string) required(:author).filled(:string) end end def handle(request, response) if request.params.valid? book = book_repo.create(request.params[:book]) response.status = 201 response.body = book.to_json else response.status = 422 response.format = :json response.body = request.params.errors.to_json end end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Basic Hanami Action in Ruby DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a basic Hanami action class implementation that handles HTTP requests. The action takes a name parameter from the request and returns a welcome message in the response body. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/actions/overview.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # app/actions/home/show.rb module Bookshelf module Actions module Home class Show < Bookshelf::Action def handle(request, response) name = request.params[:name] response.body = "Welcome to Bookshelf #{name}!" end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Validating and Rendering Book Resource in Hanami Action - Ruby DESCRIPTION: Implements a Hanami action for rendering a book resource using param validation and conditional rendering. Depends on rom-rb for data access. It checks for presence of a book, responds with JSON or 404 as needed. Inputs: HTTP request with integer book ID. Outputs: JSON body representing book or error message. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.0/introduction/getting-started.md#2025-04-23_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # app/actions/books/show.rb module Bookshelf module Actions module Books class Show < Bookshelf::Action include Deps["persistence.rom"] params do required(:id).value(:integer) end def handle(request, response) book = rom.relations[:books].by_pk( request.params[:id] ).one response.format = :json if book response.body = book.to_json else response.status = 404 response.body = {error: "not_found"}.to_json end end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Books Show Action with Parameter Validation and 404 Handling - Ruby DESCRIPTION: Implements the GET /books/:id action for showing book details. Validates that 'id' is present and an integer, uses ROM's by_pk to find the matching book, and serializes it to JSON. If not found, returns a 404 status and appropriate error message. Requires Hanami, ROM, injected 'persistence.rom', and JSON support. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/introduction/building-an-api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf module Actions module Books class Show < Bookshelf::Action include Deps["persistence.rom"] params do required(:id).value(:integer) end def handle(request, response) book = rom.relations[:books].by_pk( request.params[:id] ).one response.format = :json if book response.body = book.to_json else response.status = 404 response.body = {error: "not_found"}.to_json end end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Hanami Books Relation (Ruby) DESCRIPTION: This code shows the generated Hanami relation class `Bookshelf::Relations::Books` located in `app/relations/books.rb`. It inherits from `Bookshelf::DB::Relation` and defines the schema mapping to the `books` database table, using `infer: true` to automatically detect columns. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/introduction/building-a-web-app.md#2025-04-23_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # app/relations/books.rb module Bookshelf module Relations class Books < Bookshelf::DB::Relation schema :books, infer: true end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Parameters from Different Sources in Hanami DESCRIPTION: Shows how to access parameters from path variables, query string, and request body in a Hanami action. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/actions/parameters.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` def handle(request, response) # GET /books/1 request.params[:id] # => "1" # GET /books?category=history&page=2 request.params[:category] # => "history" request.params[:page] # => "2" # POST /books '{"title": "request body", "author":"json"}', Content-Type application/json request.params[:title] # => "request body" request.params[:author] #=> "json" end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining a Repository Class in Hanami (Ruby) DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to define a repository class in a Hanami application. The BookRepository class provides methods for interacting with the 'books' table in the database. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/database/_index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # app/repositories/book_repository.rb class BookRepository < ROM::Repository[:books] commands :create, update: :by_pk, delete: :by_pk def all books.to_a end def by_id(id) books.by_pk(id).one end def create(data) books.changeset(:create, data).commit end def update(id, data) books.by_pk(id).changeset(:update, data).commit end def delete(id) books.by_pk(id).delete end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTTP Method Route Examples DESCRIPTION: Shows different ways to define routes with various HTTP methods and endpoints including actions, Rack apps, and lambdas. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.0/routing/overview.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` get "/books", to: "books.index" # Invokes the Bookshelf::Actions:Books::Index action post "/books", to: "books.create" # Invokes the Bookshelf::Actions:Books::Create action get "/rack-app", to: RackApp.new get "/my-lambda", to: ->(env) { [200, {}, ["A Rack compatible response"]] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Book Creation Action in Ruby with Hanami DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Hanami action for creating a new book, including parameter validation and database insertion. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/introduction/building-an-api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_45 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf module Actions module Books class Create < Bookshelf::Action include Deps["persistence.rom"] params do required(:book).hash do required(:title).filled(:string) required(:author).filled(:string) end end def handle(request, response) if request.params.valid? book = rom.relations[:books].changeset(:create, request.params[:book]).commit response.status = 201 response.body = book.to_json else response.status = 422 response.format = :json response.body = request.params.errors.to_json end end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Request Parameters in Hanami Action DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to access request parameters within a Hanami action. It shows both query string and body parameters being retrieved and used. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/actions/_index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Books class Create < Action def handle(request, response) title = request.params[:title] author = request.params[:author] # Create a new book... response.body = "Created book #{title} by #{author}" end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing Cookies in Hanami DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to remove a cookie by setting its value to nil. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/actions/cookies.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` response.cookies["tasty_cookie"] = nil ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Action with Parameter Validation for Books Index - Ruby DESCRIPTION: Enhances the books index action with strong parameter validation for 'page' and 'per_page' using Hanami's params schema. Ensures both are positive integers and per_page does not exceed 100. If params are invalid, returns HTTP 422 status and can provide error details. Builds upon the same dependencies and default pagination logic. Requires Hanami's param validation DSL. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/introduction/building-an-api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf module Actions module Books class Index < Bookshelf::Action include Deps["persistence.rom"] params do optional(:page).value(:integer, gt?: 0) optional(:per_page).value(:integer, gt?: 0, lteq?: 100) end def handle(request, response) halt 422 unless request.params.valid? books = rom.relations[:books] .select(:title, :author) .order(:title) .page(request.params[:page] || 1) .per_page(request.params[:per_page] || 5) .to_a response.format = :json response.body = books.to_json end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating a New Hanami Project using CLI DESCRIPTION: Example of how to create a new Hanami project called 'bookshelf' using the hanami new command. This is the basic command to initialize a new Hanami application with default settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v1.3/command-line/project.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` $ hanami new bookshelf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing and Creating a New Hanami Project with Shell Commands DESCRIPTION: Commands to install the Hanami gem and create a new project called 'bookshelf'. This initializes a new Hanami application with the default SQLite database. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v1.3/introduction/getting-started.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` $ gem install hanami $ hanami new bookshelf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Environment-Specific Settings in Hanami App (Ruby) DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to configure environment-specific settings for a Hanami application. It demonstrates adding a custom middleware for the production environment using the environment method. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/app/app-config.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # config/app.rb module Bookshelf class App < Hanami::App environment(:production) do require "my_custom_middleware" config.middleware.use MyCustomMiddleware end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Initial Hanami Application Routes (Ruby) DESCRIPTION: This code shows the initial structure of the Hanami routes file (`config/routes.rb`). It defines a `Bookshelf::Routes` class inheriting from `Hanami::Routes`, which is the central place for defining application URL mappings. Initially, no routes are defined. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/introduction/building-a-web-app.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # config/routes.rb module Bookshelf class Routes < Hanami::Routes # Add your routes here. See https://guides.hanamirb.org/routing/overview/ for details. end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cleaning Databases Between RSpec Tests Using DatabaseCleaner - Ruby DESCRIPTION: Provides detailed setup for spec/support/db/cleaning.rb to clean all configured app and slice databases between tests using DatabaseCleaner. Initializes a proc to extract all relevant db connections, and configures before/after suite and each test for truncation or transaction cleaning strategies depending on metadata (e.g., :js). Requires database_cleaner-sequel, sequel, and RSpec gems, and expects Hanami.app to be available with properly registered db.rom keys. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/upgrade-notes/v2.2.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # frozen_string_literal: true\n\nrequire \"database_cleaner/sequel\"\n\n# Clean the databases between tests tagged as `:db`\nRSpec.configure do |config|\n # Returns all the configured databases across the app and its slices.\n #\n # Used in the before/after hooks below to ensure each database is cleaned between examples.\n #\n # Modify this proc (or any code below) if you only need specific databases cleaned.\n all_databases = -> {\n slices = [Hanami.app] + Hanami.app.slices.with_nested\n\n slices.each_with_object([]) { |slice, dbs|\n next unless slice.key?(\"db.rom\")\n\n dbs.concat slice[\"db.rom\"].gateways.values.map(&:connection)\n }.uniq\n }\n\n config.before :suite do\n all_databases.call.each do |db|\n DatabaseCleaner[:sequel, db: db].clean_with :truncation, except: [\"schema_migrations\"]\n end\n end\n\n config.before :each, :db do |example|\n strategy = example.metadata[:js] ? :truncation : :transaction\n\n all_databases.call.each do |db|\n DatabaseCleaner[:sequel, db: db].strategy = strategy\n DatabaseCleaner[:sequel, db: db].start\n end\n end\n\n config.after :each, :db do\n all_databases.call.each do |db|\n DatabaseCleaner[:sequel, db: db].clean\n end\n end\nend ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Basic Routes in Hanami DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to define basic routes in a Hanami application using the 'config/routes.rb' file. It shows examples of routing to different controllers and actions. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/routing/_index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # config/routes.rb module Bookshelf class Routes < Hanami::Routes root { "Hello from Hanami!" } get "/books", to: "books.index" get "/books/:id", to: "books.show" end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Interactive Boot Process Example DESCRIPTION: Series of IRB commands demonstrating the step-by-step process of preparing and booting a Hanami application, showing component registration and lazy loading behavior. ': uninitialized constant Hanami (NameError) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complex Parameter Validation in Hanami User Creation Action DESCRIPTION: Illustrates a more complex parameter validation schema for a user creation action, including nested parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/introduction/building-an-api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_27 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # app/actions/books/index.rb module Bookshelf module Actions module Books class Index < Bookshelf::Action include Deps["repos.book_repo"] params do optional(:page).value(:integer, gt?: 0) optional(:per_page).value(:integer, gt?: 0, lteq?: 100) end def handle(request, response) halt 422 unless request.params.valid? books = book_repo.all_by_title( page: request.params[:page] || 1, per_page: request.params[:per_page] || 5 ) response.format = :json response.body = books.map(&:to_h).to_json end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RSpec Request Spec for Paginated Books Index Endpoint - Ruby DESCRIPTION: Provides a request spec using RSpec to verify pagination in the /books API endpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v1.3/repositories/sql-queries.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` class UserRepository < Hanami::Repository def by_name(name) users.where { name.ilike("%?%", name) } end def by_id_in(input) users.where { id.in(input) } end def by_id_in_range(range) users.where { id.in(range) } end def by_id_min_max(min, max) users.where { id > min || id < max } end def by_not_id(input) users.where { id.not(input) } end def by_id_not_in_range(range) users.where { id.not(1..100) } end def by_name_length(input) users.where { length(:name) > input } end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Simplified Show Action with Delegated Exception Handling - Ruby DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a Hanami action for showing a book, now simplified to rely on the base Action's exception handling. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/database/relations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf module Relations class Books < Hanami::DB::Relation schema :books, infer: true do associations do has_many :authors, through: :authorships end end end class Authorships < Hanami::DB::Relation schema :authorships do primary_key :id # These may also be inferred from the db if # they are actual foreign keys, but this is # how you would do it manually. attribute :book_id, Types.ForeignKey(:books) attribute :author_id, Types.ForeignKey(:authors) attribute :order, Types::Integer associations do belongs_to :book belongs_to :author end end end class Authors < Hanami::DB::Relation schema :authors, infer: true do has_many :books, through: :authorships end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing CRUD Methods for Has One Association in Hanami DESCRIPTION: Extended UserRepository implementation with methods to add, remove, update, and replace the associated avatar. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v1.3/actions/testing.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Web module Controllers module Dashboard class Index include Web::Action expose :current_account before :authenticate! def call(params) redirect end private def authenticate! redirect_to('/login') unless current_account end def current_account @current_account ||= AccountRepository.new.find(session[:account_id]) end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Base Hanami Action with Exception Handling DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a base Hanami action class with common exception handling logic for ROM::TupleCountMismatchError. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/introduction/building-an-api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_39 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # app/action.rb # auto_register: false require "hanami/action" module Bookshelf class Action < Hanami::Action config.handle_exception ROM::TupleCountMismatchError => :handle_not_found private def handle_not_found(_request, response, _exception) response.status = 404 response.format = :json response.body = {error: "not_found"}.to_json end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Context and Delegating Methods in a Hanami Scope Class - Ruby DESCRIPTION: This example shows how a scope class method can access the rendering context (such as `routes`) via `context`, and build URLs or invoke context-specific methods. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/introduction/building-a-web-app.md#2025-04-23_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # lib/bookshelf/persistence/relations/books.rb module Bookshelf module Persistence module Relations class Books < ROM::Relation[:sql] schema(:books, infer: true) use :pagination per_page 5 end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Proc Callbacks in Hanami Action DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement a before callback using a proc instead of a method. It implements an `all_by_title` method that retrieves all books from the database, specifically selecting the `title` and `author` columns, orders them by title ascending, and returns the result as an array. Named routes allow for easier reference and generate path helpers for use in views and controllers. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v1.3/routing/_index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # config.ru require 'hanami/router' app = Hanami::Router.new do get '/', to: ->(env) { [200, {}, ['Home']] }, as: :home get '/dashboard', to: ->(env) { [200, {}, ['Dashboard']] }, as: :dashboard end run app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Application-Level Middleware in Hanami DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to add middleware at the application level using the config.middleware.use method in the Hanami app configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/actions/http-caching.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # app/actions/books/index.rb module Bookshelf module Actions module Books class Index < Bookshelf::Action def handle(request, response) # Sets `Cache-Control: public, max-age: 600` response.cache_control :public, max_age: 600 end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Route Scopes in Hanami (Ruby) DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use route scopes to group related routes under a common namespace. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v1.3/routing/basic-usage.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # apps/web/config/routes.rb get '/dashboard', to: "dashboard#index" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Unit Testing Hanami View Parts (Ruby) DESCRIPTION: Defines a view part class in Hanami with a custom display_name method combining user name and email, and provides an RSpec test that ensures this formatting. Includes use of test doubles and part initialization with value. Requires Hanami part base class and RSpec. Main focus is confirming string formatting by the part when given a user mock. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/views/testing.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module MyApp module Views module Parts class User < MyApp::Views::Part def display_name "#{name} (#{email})" end end end end end RSpec.describe(MyApp::Views::Parts::User) do subject(:part) { described_class.new(value: user) } let(:user) { double(:user, name: "Amy", email: "amy@example.com"} describe "#display_name" do it "includes the name and email" do expect(part.display_name).to eq "Amy (amy@example.com)" end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using a Non-Registered Class in Hanami Operations (Ruby) DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use a non-registered class (SlackNotifier) within a Hanami operation. This example shows the SendWelcomeEmail operation using both container-registered and non-registered dependencies. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/app/container-and-components.md#2025-04-23_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # app/operations/send_welcome_email.rb module Bookshelf module Operations class SendWelcomeEmail include Deps[ "email_client", "renderers.welcome_email" ] def call(name:, email_address:) email_client.deliver( to: email_address, subject: "Welcome!", text_body: welcome_email.render_text(name: name), html_body: welcome_email.render_html(name: name) ) SlackNotifier.notify("Welcome email sent to #{email_address}") end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating User with Avatar in Hanami DESCRIPTION: Example code showing how to create a user with associated avatar using the repository methods. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v1.3/associations/has-one.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` repository = UserRepository.new user = repository.create_with_avatar(name: "Luca", avatar: { url: "https://avatars.test/luca.png" }) # => #1, :name=>"Luca", :created_at=>2017-10-24 08:44:27 UTC, :updated_at=>2017-10-24 08:44:27 UTC, :avatar=>#1, :user_id=>1, :url=>"https://avatars.test/luca.png", :created_at=>2017-10-24 08:44:27 UTC, :updated_at=>2017-10-24 08:44:27 UTC}>}> user.id # => 1 user.name # => "Luca" user.avatar # => #1, :user_id=>1, :url=>"https://avatars.test/luca.png", :created_at=>2017-10-24 08:44:27 UTC, :updated_at=>2017-10-24 08:44:27 UTC}> ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing Exposures in Hanami Actions DESCRIPTION: This test example demonstrates how to verify the exposed values in a Hanami action. It checks both individual exposures and the complete exposures hash. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v1.3/actions/testing.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # spec/web/controllers/users/show_spec.rb require_relative '../../../../apps/web/controllers/users/show' RSpec.describe Web::Controllers::Users::Show do let(:user) { UserRepository.new.create(name: 'Luca') } let(:action) { Web::Controllers::Users::Show.new } it "is successful" do response = action.call(id: user.id) expect(response[0]).to be(200) action.user.must_equal user action.exposures.must_equal({user: user, foo: 'bar'}) end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Current Environment with Hanami.env DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use Hanami.env to get the current environment as a symbol. The method returns the value of HANAMI_ENV as a symbol. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/app/environments.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # HANAMI_ENV=development Hanami.env => :development ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Integrating Dependencies in Hanami View Class using Deps Mixin DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to include dependencies in a Hanami view class using the Deps mixin. The example shows a Books::Show view that depends on a book repository and exposes a book object based on an ID parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/views/working-with-dependencies.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # app/views/books/show.rb module Bookshelf module Views module Books class Show < Bookshelf::View include Deps["repositories.book_repo"] expose :book do |id:| book_repo.get!(id) end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RSpec Request Spec for Book Show Endpoint - Ruby DESCRIPTION: Defines an RSpec request spec for the GET /books/:id endpoint. Tests both the case where a matching book is found (returns 200 and book details as JSON) and where no matching book is found (returns 404 and an error JSON). Requires RSpec, JSON support, and a prepopulated test database. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/introduction/building-an-api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` RSpec.describe "GET /books/:id", type: [:request, :database] do let(:books) { app["persistence.rom"].relations[:books] } context "when a book matches the given id" do let!(:book_id) do books.insert(title: "Test Driven Development", author: "Kent Beck") end it "renders the book" do get "/books/#{book_id}" expect(last_response).to be_successful expect(last_response.content_type).to eq("app/json; charset=utf-8") response_body = JSON.parse(last_response.body) expect(response_body).to eq( "id" => book_id, "title" => "Test Driven Development", "author" => "Kent Beck" ) end end context "when no book matches the given id" do it "returns not found" do get "/books/#{books.max(:id).to_i + 1}" expect(last_response).to be_not_found expect(last_response.content_type).to eq("app/json; charset=utf-8") response_body = JSON.parse(last_response.body) expect(response_body).to eq( "error" => "not_found" ) end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Email Client Provider Implementation in Ruby DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates creating a provider for registering an email client service. Shows how to prepare dependencies and configure the client with settings from the application container. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/app/providers.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # config/providers/email_client.rb Hanami.app.register_provider(:email_client) do prepare do require "acme_email/client" end start do client = AcmeEmail::Client.new( api_key: target["settings"].acme_api_key, default_from: "no-reply@bookshelf.example.com" ) register "email_client", client end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Renaming Dependencies with Deps Mixin in Hanami (Ruby) DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates using the `Deps` mixin in a Hanami operation (`SendWelcomeEmail`) to inject dependencies. It shows how to inject a dependency with its standard key (`"email_client"`) and how to rename another dependency (`"renderers.welcome_email"`) to a more convenient local alias (`email_renderer`). The aliased dependency is then used within the `call` method. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/app/container-and-components.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` ```ruby title="app/operations/send_welcome_email.rb" module Bookshelf module Operations class SendWelcomeEmail include Deps[ "email_client", email_renderer: "renderers.welcome_email" ] def call(name:, email_address:) email_client.deliver( to: email_address, subject: "Welcome!", text_body: email_renderer.render_text(name: name), html_body: email_renderer.render_html(name: name) ) end end end end ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Test Environment Settings in Hanami Console (Ruby) DESCRIPTION: Ruby code demonstrating how to access environment variables loaded from `.env` files within the Hanami console running in the test environment. It retrieves `database_url` and `analytics_enabled` settings using `Hanami.app["settings"]`. Requires that _context.request is available in contexts where views are rendered within an action. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/views/helpers.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` def current_path?(path) path == _context.request.fullpath end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing a Custom Query Method in a Hanami Repository DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to create a custom query method in a Hanami repository to fetch the most recent books by an author, improving code organization and abstraction. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v1.3/repositories/overview.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # lib/bookshelf/repositories/book_repository.rb class BookRepository < Hanami::Repository def most_recent_by_author(author, limit: 8) books .where(author_id: author.id) .order(:published_at) .limit(limit) end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Hanami App Session Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration for enabling cookie-based sessions in Hanami application SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/introduction/building-a-web-app.md#2025-04-23_snippet_23 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf class App < Hanami::App config.actions.sessions = :cookie, { key: "bookshelf.session", secret: settings.session_secret, expire_after: 60*60*24*365 } end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Many-to-One Association in Hanami Relation DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to define a many-to-one association between books and languages in Hanami relations. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/database/relations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf module Relations class Books < Hanami::DB::Relation schema :books, infer: true do associations do belongs_to :language end end end class Languages < Hanami::DB::Relation schema :languages, infer: true do associations do has_many :books end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Including Dependencies via Deps in Hanami View (Ruby) DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to declare a Hanami view class (Show) that uses the Deps mixin to inject the book_repo dependency. The code must be placed under app/views/books/show.rb, following Hanami conventions. No external dependencies except Ruby stdlib Pathname are required. The SPEC_ROOT.glob line ensures test helper files in support/ are loaded, enabling modularized rspec configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/upgrade-notes/v2.2.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` # frozen_string_literal: true\n\nrequire \"pathname\"\nSPEC_ROOT = Pathname(__dir__).realpath.freeze\n\n# \n\nSPEC_ROOT.glob(\"support/**/*.rb\").each { |f| require f } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Authentication Module for Hanami Actions DESCRIPTION: Defines a reusable authentication module that can be included in any action requiring authentication functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.1/actions/inheritance.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf module Actions module AuthenticatedAction def self.included(action_class) action_class.before :authenticate_user! end private def authenticate_user!(request, response) # halt 401 unless ... end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining One-to-Many Association in Hanami Relation DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to define a one-to-many association between publishers and books in a Hanami relation. SOURCE: https://github.com/hanami/guides/blob/main/content/v2.2/database/relations.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Bookshelf module Relations class Publishers < Hanami::DB::Relation schema :publishers, infer: true do associations do has_many :books end end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Router-Level Middleware in Hanami DESCRIPTION: This Ruby code snippet demonstrates how to add middleware at the router level in a Hanami application.
